memories.content:
Plasma Thief: Sky Rogue - Complete Project Overview

**Project Name**: Plasma Thief: Sky Rogue
**Type**: Unity 3D aerial combat portfolio demo with Web3 integration
**Timeline**: 3-4 weeks development for 2-3 level demo

**Core Concept**: 
- Player controls a rogue permanently mounted on a plasma dragon
- Aerial combat against AI-powered bosses and adaptive enemies
- Seamless Web2-to-Web3 onboarding with Solana blockchain rewards
- No ground combat - entirely aerial gameplay

**Key Technical Features**:
1. MCP Unity Integration (Critical - must work first)
2. 360° dragon flight mechanics using "3rd Person Controller + Fly Mode" (free asset)
3. Dual weapon system: Plasma orbs (area damage) and rapid fireballs
4. AI-powered bosses using Claude/GPT API ($0.01-0.02 per session)
5. WebGL deployment targeting 60fps desktop, 30fps mobile
6. Auto-wallet generation for blockchain rewards

**Development Priorities**:
1. MCP integration and Unity setup
2. Flight controller and dragon mechanics
3. Combat system with dual weapons
4. AI boss integration
5. Web3 token rewards
6. Polish and optimization

**Budget**: $20-65 one-time costs, $5-30 monthly for AI/tools

Plasma Thief: Game Design Details

**Gameplay Loop**:
1. Approach Phase (30-45s): Scout fortress, identify boss, dodge fire
2. Combat Phase (2-3min): Fight AI boss, destroy turrets, manage health
3. Collection Phase (15-30s): Swoop for treasure, escape, earn tokens

**Combat System**:
- Primary: Plasma Orb - 100 damage, 10ft radius AOE, 2s cooldown, one-shots groups
- Secondary: Rapid Fireballs - 25 damage, 5/second rate, machine-gun style
- Controls: Left click plasma, right click fireballs, Q switch weapons

**Enemy Types**:
- Archer Towers: 1 HP, fixed position, predictable
- Ballista Turrets: 2 HP, predictive targeting, medium threat
- Military Patrols: Groups of 5-10, 1 HP each, die to single plasma AOE
- Smart enemies in Level 2 learn from player patterns

**Boss System**:
- Elite Commander (Level 1): 100 HP, multiple attacks, AI-driven decisions
- Veteran Commander (Level 2): Remembers Level 1 tactics, adapts strategy
- Uses Claude/GPT API every 10-15 seconds for decision making
- Visible behavior changes each playthrough

**Token Economy**:
- Free to play demo
- Level 1: 5 tokens
- Level 2: 8 tokens  
- Level 3: 10 tokens (optional)
- Perfect run bonus: +3 tokens

Plasma Thief: Technical Architecture & Requirements

**Unity Setup**:
- Unity 2022.3 LTS (latest patch)
- 3D Built-in Render Pipeline (not URP/HDRP)
- WebGL target platform
- Project name: PlasmaThief_DragonRogue

**Folder Structure**:
Assets/
├── _Project/
│   ├── Scripts/
│   │   ├── Player/
│   │   ├── AI/
│   │   ├── Combat/
│   │   ├── Web3/
│   │   └── Utilities/
│   ├── Prefabs/
│   ├── Materials/
│   ├── Textures/
│   └── Audio/
├── _ImportedAssets/
├── Plugins/
└── StreamingAssets/

**Performance Targets**:
- 60 FPS desktop browsers
- 30 FPS mobile browsers
- <50MB compressed build size
- <20 second load time
- 256MB RAM usage limit

**Essential Packages**:
- Cinemachine (camera control)
- Post Processing Stack v2
- TextMeshPro
- Unity Particle Pack
- Solana.Unity-SDK
- UnityAsync

**WebGL Build Settings**:
- Gzip compression
- Exception handling: None
- IL2CPP Code Generation
- Target WebAssembly
- Memory Size: 256MB

Plasma Thief: Development Phases & Milestones

**Week 1: Core Systems**
Days 1-2: Environment & Flight
- Set up MCP integration (CRITICAL - must work first)
- Import island/castle assets (free from Asset Store)
- Implement flight controller using free "3rd Person Controller + Fly Mode"
- Basic camera follow system

Days 3-4: Dragon Setup
- Import dragon model (free "Dragon for Boss Monster: HP" or purchase $20-40)
- Configure animations (fly, attack, grab)
- Add plasma orb shooting
- Visual effects setup

Days 5-7: Combat Basics
- Enemy turrets/archers
- Basic projectile system
- Health/damage mechanics
- Simple UI elements

**Week 2: AI & Web3**
Days 8-10: AI Boss Integration
- Simple API connection (Claude/GPT)
- Boss decision-making system
- Adaptive difficulty
- Response caching for cost control

Days 11-14: Web3 Setup
- Solana wallet integration
- Token reward system
- Simple landing page
- WebGL deployment

**Week 3: Polish**
Days 15-17: Level 2
- Same environment, smarter enemies
- AI learns from Level 1
- Visual feedback for adaptation

Days 18-21: Final Polish
- Optimization for WebGL
- Bug fixes
- Landing page improvements
- Demo video recording

Plasma Thief: Critical Implementation Details

**MCP Unity Integration (HIGHEST PRIORITY)**:
- Must install Unity MCP server from https://github.com/CoderGamester/mcp-unity
- Configure MCP connection in Cursor IDE settings
- Test with simple commands like "Create empty GameObject"
- This MUST work before proceeding with any other development

**Asset Strategy**:
Dragon Models:
- Option A: Unity Asset Store dragons ($20-40) with flight animations
- Option B: 3D AI Generation with Meshy AI ($20/mo) - backup only
- Recommended free: "Dragon for Boss Monster: HP"

Flight Controller:
- Primary: "3rd Person Controller + Fly Mode" (Asset ID: 28647) - FREE
- Alternative: Arcade Flight Controller ($25.45) if needed
- Custom enhancement on top of free controller

Environment:
- Free castle/island assets from Asset Store
- "Free Fantasy Castle" or similar
- Terrain Tools Sample Asset Pack

**Key Code Structures**:
- EnhancedDragonFlightController (extends free asset)
- DragonWeaponSystem (plasma orbs + fireballs)
- AIBossController (API integration)
- TokenRewardSystem (Web3 rewards)

**Testing Checkpoints**:
1. MCP connection working
2. Dragon flying smoothly at 60fps
3. Dual weapons firing properly
4. WebGL build under 50MB
5. AI boss making decisions
6. Token rewards distributing

1. Project Location: /home/benton/projects/Unity3d-Projects/PlasmaDragonPrj/PlasmaDragon

2. Current Structure:
   - Documentation exists (PRD, GDD, Architecture docs)

   - Timeline: 4-week development (160 hours)

4. What Needs to Be Created:

   - Version control setup (.gitignore for Unity)
